page.title: 01Blackhills of Moray
page.content: This is an area of contrasts. The fertile farming land of Blackhills Estate gives way to uncultivated moorland as we climb to Brown Muir 338ft above sea level where a trig station and radio telephone mast are situated. To the west lies Hillbuies country park gifted to Elgin for people to enjoy country walks, picnics or fishing. Part of the estate is given overto forest trees as a commercial enterprise. On the surrounding hills crops are grown and cattle graze giving way to sheep on the higher ground. To the south west lies coleburn distillery which unfortunatly ceased production on 31st April due to a recession in the whiskey industry. Few people live in this area. There are about 1500 acres of mooreland & 700 acres of woodland not all of which is
